briefdescription.para: Used to compute the total time of the simulation.
A flag used to know if the counters are paused or not.
A flag used to know if the two first time steps are over or not.
pointer to the last opened counter. Each counter has a parent attribute, which also give the pointer of the counter open before them.
By default, we consider that the two first time steps are used to file the cache, so they are not taken into account in the stats.
A flag used to know if we are inside the time loop.
the duration in seconds of the cache. If cache is too long, use function set_three_first_steps_elapsed in oder to include the stats of the cache in your stats

parameterdescription.para: key of the map (custom_counter_map_str_to_counter_) of the custom counter you try to close

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string counter_description, int counter_level, std::string counter_family, bool is_comm, bool is_gpu)
memberdef.name: create_custom_counter_impl

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &custom_count_name, int count_increment, long int quantity_increment)
memberdef.name: end_count_impl

briefdescription.para: End the count of a counter and update the counter values.

parameterdescription.para: is the custom counter to end the count
is the count increment. If not specified, then it is equal to 1
is the increment of custom variable quantity. If not specified, it is set to 0.

memberdef.argsstring: (const STD_COUNTERS &std_cnt, int count_increment, long int quantity_increment)
memberdef.name: end_count_impl

briefdescription.para: End the count of a counter and update the counter values.

parameterdescription.para: is the counter to end the count
is the count increment. If not specified, then it is equal to 1
is the increment of custom variable quantity. If not specified, it is set to 0.

briefdescription.para: Compute for each counter open during a time step avg_time_per_step_, min_time_per_step_, max_time_per_step_ and sd_time_per_step_.

detaileddescription.para:
Called at the end of each time step, and only then
tstep
number of time steps elapsed since the start of the computation
Nota : if the counter is called before the time step loop, it is not accounted for in the computation.

inbodydescription.para: < stop_counters already updated c->tim_ts_

briefdescription.para: Restart all counters, has to be called on every processor simultaneously.
Stop all counters, has to be called on every processor simultaneously.

simplesect.para: string that contains cpu model and number of proc
string with complete date and time : DD-MM-YYYY hour:minute:second

briefdescription.para: Return a string that contains os information.

detaileddescription.para: for example: node name = is247793 system name = Linux machine = x86_64 release = 6.5.0-44-generic version = #44~22.04.1-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC + current date and time

simplesect.para: string with is, os info and date

We specify the width of large items of lines of the _csv.Tu file for making it readable by human
Then we create a vector line_items that contains each item we want to print
After filling line_items and item_size, we use the function build_line_csv to build the line at the expected format
